3. 樟宜机场集团收集的个人数据
如本《隐私政策》所述，樟宜机场集团将在其认为合理需要的情况下，向您和/或樟宜机场集团的其他成员和/或其他第三方收集您的个人数据。如果您不提供或无法提供该等个人数据，樟宜机场集团可能无法提供您需要的产品和/服务。
我们收集的与您有关的个人数据的示例包括：
身份和联系方式数据
通过个人数据得出的推论
财务和付款数据
商业信息
索赔信息
个人资料、使用情况和技术数据
物理访问数据
出入境相关信息
4. 我们如何收集您的个人数据
樟宜机场集团以各种各样的方式收集个人数据，其中包括下列方式：
直接互动
我们也可以通过其他方式直接收集个人数据，包括在：
您申请樟宜机场集团集团任何成员提供的任何产品或服务；
您注册并参加由樟宜机场集团任何成员提供的任何会籍；
您在平台上开设帐户；
您订阅樟宜机场集团任何成员提供的任何通信或出版物；
您要求樟宜机场集团任何成员向您发送营销信息；
您参加樟宜机场集团任何成员开展的竞赛、促销或调查；
您向我们提供反馈；
您在新加坡樟宜机场连接 WiFi；
您使用樟宜机场集团任何成员开发的或为其开发的移动或网络应用程序；或
您通过热门聊天平台（如 WhatsApp 和 Telegram）与我们或我们的聊天机器人沟通；或
我们在新加坡樟宜机场安装的摄像头拍到的或官方摄影师/摄像师在各种活动和节目中拍到的您的图像（包括录像）。
我们也可能从以下来源或通过以下方式收集您的个人数据：

自动化技术或互动

5. 我们如何使用您的个人数据
樟宜机场集团成员竭力优化其运营以及通过不同渠道（包括平台）向您提供的产品和/或服务，例如提供相关的、个性化的内容，打造更顺畅、更愉悦的用户体验。为有效了解和满足您的需求，樟宜机场集团（或其任何成员）可能会出于与其职能和活动相关的目的处理您的个人数据，包括以下任意一个或多个目的：
方便您前往机场的各个接触点；
向您提供服务和帮助我们开发、改善、运行和管理樟宜机场集团（或其任何成员）向您提供的服务，包括在平台上和通过平台提供的服务和 WiFi 服务；
帮助我们核实您的身份，以便处理和管理任何会员申请或注册；
向您发送樟宜机场集团任何成员的相关推广活动、优惠、机会、产品、福利和规划的通知以及营销信息；
开展市场营销活动，包括市场研究、客户分析、客户洞察和定向营销活动；
进行性能分析和统计数据分析，改善为您提供的服务，包括匹配和汇总您通过不同渠道提供的信息，以便了解宜机场集团（或其任何成员）如何更好地为您服务；
通知您宜机场集团（或其任何成员）的规划、政策、条款与条件的变更、平台更新和其他管理信息；
管理和开展樟宜机场集团任何成员规划、推广、活动和竞赛；
预防、侦查和调查安全事故或违规行为、犯罪（包括欺诈）以及分析和管理其他风险；
按照您的特殊偏好对平台和平台的内容进行个性化设置；
进行调查、问卷调查和请求反馈；
回应您的询问、请求、反馈和投诉；
为了推广和宣传，包括在樟宜机场集团任何成员组织、主办或参与的活动或工作中对参与者录像或拍照；
为了达到任何适用法律法规、可执行的政府请求或法庭命令的要求；
管理您或您的组织与樟宜机场集团签订的任何合同；
查找、预防或以其他方式解决与平台提供的服务相关的安全或技术问题；
管理您对我们的办公场所和设施（无论是在新加坡樟宜机场还是其他地方）的访问和使用；和/或
实现在收集您的信息时向您发出的数据保护和隐私通知中可能明确注明的其他目的。

7. 个人数据处理的法律依据
同意：

8. 指向第三方网站的链接
我们可能在平台中提供指向第三方网站的链接。您使用该等第三方网站须遵守其隐私政策，我们不对这些政策概不负责。我们鼓励您阅读您浏览的其他网站的隐私政策。一旦离开平台，您应当在该等第三方各自的网站上查看其适用的隐私政策，确定他们将如何处理向您收集的信息。因为对于我们可能链接的其他网站的政策或您可能与他们分享的任何数据的使用，我们无法控制或承担责任，所以您浏览此类第三方网站需自负风险。
9. 保障您的个人数据的安全
我们将采取合理的技术和程序性措施保护您的个人数据，例如：
确保您在我方开设的任何个人帐户的访问权限由密码和用户名控制，且该密码和用户名只属于您；
在安全的服务器上存储您的个人数据；以及
基于“需要知道”原则限制个人数据的访问权限。
请注意，使用互联网和/或平台无法实现绝对安全，因此我们不能保证您通过平台发送或者向您发送的任何个人数据是安全或完整的。您承诺数据传输的风险由您承担。
10. 个人数据 – 访问和更正
请您确保我们收集的数据的准确性——您承诺您将提供准确和完整的个人数据，并不时更新向我方提供的该等个人数据。在向我方提供个人数据之前，您应当仔细检查您向我方提供的信息是否完整、准确。
您可按照本政策说明的联系方式联系我们，请求访问和/或更正我们持有的您的个人数据。所有访问和/或更正请求将在合理时间内得到处理，但我们按照任何适用法律或法规拒绝此类请求的除外。在某些情况下，您可以通过平台直接访问和更正您的个人信息。对于平台自助服务功能之外的请求，在受理您的请求之前，我们可能需要核实您的身份。为了进行核实，我们可能需要您提供支持性信息或文件资料。
对于平台自助服务功能之外的所有请求，我们可能会收取合理的费用来处理和受理您的请求。
11. 欧盟（“EU”）数据主体的其他权利
樟宜机场集团是在新加坡成立的公司。我们没有在欧盟设立实体。
然而，如果您是欧盟的数据主体，且您认为《通用数据保护条例》（EU 2016/679）（“
要求删除您的个人数据；
要求限制对您的个人数据的处理；
拒绝对您的个人数据进行处理；和/或
要求将您的个人数据传输至您或第三方。
在受理您的请求之前，我们可能会核实您的身份和诉求。
在 GDPR 适用的情况下，如果我们违反了任何适用法律或法规，您也有权向相关的欧盟监管机构投诉。
向我们提出的、行使以上权利的请求将在合理时间内得到处理，但我们按照任何适用法律或法规拒绝此类请求的除外。
12. 数据保留
当我们收集您个人数据的目的终止和/或我们无需再为了任何法律或商业目的继续保留您的个人数据时，我们将停止保留您的个人数据。
13. 未经请求的信息

如果您向我方提供了未经请求的个人数据，例如未经请求的电子邮件或留言板上的公开帖子，即表示您同意樟宜机场集团在我们认为合适的、不保密的情况上使用未经请求的个人数据，樟宜机场集团有权自由使用、披露、分发和利用该等未经请求的个人数据，不受限制，亦不注明出处。樟宜机场集团竭力采取合理措施销毁或识别对樟宜机场集团毫无用途的、未经请求的个人数据，但由于既定系统和操作限制，樟宜机场集团无法保证处理所有未经请求的个人数据。如果您不同意我们对您提供的未经请求的个人数据的处理方式，您有责任不向樟宜机场集团提供我们未向您索取的个人数据。
14. 本政策的变更
为反映我们处理个人数据方式的变更或法律要求的变动，我们可能会不时修改本政策（包括《Cookies 政策》）。未来本政策的变更都将在本页面上公布，我们会适当通过平台或其他通讯渠道通知您。如使用我们的服务，您承诺定期查看相关网站或平台版块是否更新。

Full-time Careers
To ensure a holistic and fair assessment of all applications, we encourage you to apply only through our

Yes, you can apply for more than one role. However, we encourage you to take the time to tailor each application to the specific requirements and qualifications of the respective roles. In your cover letter or application, clearly express your interest in multiple roles. This will help our hiring team understand your interests.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified by our recruiters for an interview. If you haven’t heard from us in two months about your application, it is likely that we have proceeded with other candidates for that particular role.

For most of our published roles, we accept applications on a rolling basis until the position has been filled. Unless specified otherwise in the job description, there is no application deadline, although we encourage you to apply sooner rather than later. If there is a deadline specified in the job description and the deadline has lapsed, we are unable to accept further applications.

Yes, we welcome applicants of any nationality to apply for our full-time roles. We will gladly assist candidates who have accepted our job offer to seek the necessary work authorisation from the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), Singapore.
The interview process varies from hiring team to team. Not all positions require assessments or technical tests. Your recruiter will advise you on what to expect and prepare.

We send out offers on a rolling basis. The recruiter will contact you to discuss your offer typically within 2 weeks of your final round interview. Should you not have been advanced through the application process, we will notify you within 2 weeks of your final round interview. Due to the high volume of applications, we will not be able to provide individual feedback on the outcome of the application.
Internship

We offer a wide range of internship positions for students across different functions. To explore our current internship opportunities and programmes, along with their specific eligibility requirements, please visit our

Internship opportunities with CAG are typically published on the internship portals of the schools we partner with. Internships are commonly offered during the Summer vacation (May to July) or Winter vacation (November to December), although some hiring teams may offer off-cycle internships during academic term time (where approval from the school would be required).
To ensure that all applications are holistically assessed and well-received, we encourage all students to apply only through your school. We typically do not accept unsolicited

We expect international candidates to have the necessary endorsement/approvals from their school to take up an internship/training with CAG. In addition, international students would need to obtain the proper work authorisations (e.g. Work Holiday Pass) from the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), Singapore. International students should seek information from MOM and speak with their school’s career advisors for more information on obtaining the correct work authorisation to undergo an internship/training in Singapore.
The Talent Internship Programme (TIP) is a structured summer internship programme.
There are other non-TIP internships which are offered year-round. You may wish to check for any such internship opportunities that we may publish through your school.
We would not be able to hire you as an intern if you have already graduated or if you are currently not a registered student with any Ministry of Education (MOE) endorsed institutions of learning.

Unfortunately, We do not have internship or job shadowing opportunities for students who have already left school and are either awaiting NS enlistment, or taking a gap year. As mentioned above, you would need to be a current enrolled student to intern with us.
Yes, we offer competitive remuneration for internships.

We cannot guarantee a full-time role after your internship. However, should we identify a suitable full-time opportunity that is aligned with your skillsets, our People Team and your internship supervisor will then discuss this opportunity with you at the end of your internship.

Only applicants who have been successfully shortlisted will be notified by the hiring team for an interview. If you haven’t heard from the hiring team in two months regarding an application, it is likely that the team has proceeded with other candidates for that particular role.

Due to the high volume of applications received through the multiple school internship portals that we work with, we aren't able to provide individual status updates over email. You can check the status of your application(s) on the dashboard of your school’s internship portal.
The interview process varies from hiring team to team. Not all positions require assessments or technical tests. The hiring manager will advise you on what to expect and prepare.

We send out offers on a rolling basis. The hiring team will contact you to discuss your offer typically within two weeks of your final interview. You can also check the status of your application(s) on the dashboard of your school’s internship portal. If you are selected for the internship, the hiring team will make the offer officially through your school’s internship portal (which needs to be accepted by you on the system and also approved by the school). Conversely, we will notify you within two weeks of your final round interview, should you have not been selected for the internship.
Scholarship

The CAG undergraduate scholarship is open to students with excellent GCE 'A' Level results or equivalent (including International Baccalaureate and NUS High Diploma) or Polytechnic Diploma. This is a full scholarship which includes tuition fees and maintenance allowance, including the opportunity to pursue a postgraduate programme (subject to management’s approval). You may find out more about the scholarship programme on our
Yes, students of all nationalities may apply for the CAG undergraduate scholarship.

No, there is no minimal academic cut-off or criteria to apply. However, as the scholarship is highly competitive, we would typically expect candidates to possess excellent academic results and leadership track records.

The CAG undergraduate scholarship application period typically opens from first week of January to mid-March each year. We encourage you to submit your application early. CAG would start the selection process between January to May each year. Provisional scholarship offers may sometimes be made before the release of the A-level/IB/NUSHS/Polytechnic final examination results. These provisional scholarships are then confirmed upon the release of the respective results.

You need not wait till after you have started or completed your National Service (NS) to apply. You can apply anytime before the closing date of the scholarship cycle. Should you be offered (and accept) the scholarship, CAG will hold the scholarship offer until you have completed your NS.
You do not need to have a confirmed university offer at the time of application for the CAG undergraduate scholarship.
If you are not already enrolled or matriculated with a university, you may apply again.

Only applicants who have been successfully shortlisted will be notified by the CAG Scholarship Team. Shortlisted candidates will undergo four rounds of selections, comprising of assessment centres, psychometric tests and a panel interview with CAG management. If you haven’t heard from us in four weeks after the closing of the application cycle, it is likely that your application has not been successful.
There is no quota on the number of scholarships to be awarded. All scholarship applicants who are found suitable for the CAG undergraduate scholarship will be awarded based on merit.

No, CAG scholarship holders are encouraged to pursue their studies at reputable local or overseas universities. Our Scholarship Team and CAG management will be happy to discuss your choice of university at the offer stage.
Yes, CAG scholarship holders may pursue a degree in Law. However, scholarship holders reading Law will not be called to the Bar while serving their bond with CAG.
The bond period for the CAG undergraduate scholarship is three years and five years for local and overseas universities respectively.
The scholarship bond will commence from the first day of work for the scholar. The period of National Service does not count towards the discharge of the scholarship bond.

了解我们如何使用信息以及您可以如何保护自己的隐私。
Cookie 政策
Cookie 是您浏览的网站向您的浏览器发送的一小部分数据。Cookie 包含少量与您有关的特定信息，并记录您在平台上进行的特定活动。
我们使用“cookie”一词来涵盖您使用我们的平台时放置于您设备中的数据、文本、像素标签、透明的图像交换格式（GIF）、日志文件、网络信标或其他跟踪或追踪文件或类似技术。
我们一般将 cookie 用于以下功能：
绝对必要 cookie：我们使用这些 cookie 确保您能使用我们平台的基本特点。这包括我们用于验证用户、防止欺诈使用登录凭证以及保护您的数据的安全 cookie。如果禁用了这些 cookie，您有可能无法使用我们的平台或者它们的一些功能。
功能 cookie：我们通过存储您的偏好，例如您的姓名、地区或首选语言在您使用我们的平台时提高您的体验。
性能 cookie：对于我们的平台而言，这些 cookie 可以让我们监测平台的使用情况，衡量平台的效率并改善平台的性能。该等 cookie 可由第三方设置，包括：
Google Analytics（谷歌分析）：它是谷歌公司（“谷歌”）提供的一项网页分析服务，帮助我们监测用户如何使用我们的一些平台。谷歌使用收集的数据跟踪和考查用户使用我们的一些平台的情况，并就我们的平台上发生的活动编制报告。谷歌也可能与其他谷歌服务分享这些数据，并使用收集到的数据将其广告网络中的广告情景化和个人化。
通过该等 cookie 收集的信息经过聚合，不能用于识别您的个人身份。
目标定向 cookie：我们与 ADARA, Inc. (“ADARA”) 以及 Sojern 合作，通过它们的第三方 cookie 从您那里获得数据，用于各种营销和广告目的。它使 ADARA 和 Sojern 可以根据您在我们的网站上的浏览行为，显示来自特定第三方网站的有针对性和相关性的信息。
我们与 Adara 和 Sojern 共享的您的数据将得到严格保密，并且只用于显示相关性更高的广告。我们已经制定了严格标准以确保显示适合的广告，并且您可以停用 ADARA 和 Sojern 所显示的选择性广告。但是，我们无法控制 Adara 和 Sojern 使用第三方 cookie 的方式。ADARA 和 Sojern 收集的数据不属于可用于识别您的身份的数据。
第三方放置的其他 cookie: 我们的有些平台可能包括其中包含了第三方提供的嵌入功能、社交媒体工具或链接的页面（例如，有时可能内嵌 YouTube 视频）。这些功能或链接可能包含第三方 cookie。关于使用第三方 cookie 或者其他自动化数据收集工具的信息，请查看该等第三方的隐私政策。
在您第一次访问平台时，如果您已根据您的浏览器的弹出框或者设备中的信息提供事先同意，樟宜机场集团  将仅使用非必要 cookie（例如性能 cookie、目标定向 cookie 以及第三方 cookie）。
如果您想在任何时间撤消同意，您必须使用您的浏览器设置删除您的 cookie 并禁用相关 cookie。请参照以下第 4 条了解如何操作。
通过您的浏览器或设备：如果您想限制、阻止或删除我们或者我们的任何第三方放置的 cookie，您可以通过您的浏览器设置实现。每个浏览器均有不同，因此请查阅您的浏览器的“帮助”选单，以了解修改您的 cookie 的正确方法。如果您决定禁用所有 cookie，我们无法保证我们网站的性能，并且某些功能可能无法按预期使用。
通过第三方网站：
谷歌：如果您想选择退出 Google Analytics（谷歌分析），您可以下载并在您的网页浏览器中安装插件。欲获得更多信息，请点击此处：
ADARA: 您可以通过浏览
Sojern: 您可以通过浏览

Every year, hundreds of students and graduates from every corner of the world join Changi Airport Group. Give your aspirations the space and scope to be realised with a scholarship or internship with us.
Corporate & Marketing Communications Internship
LIT Internship
Talent Internship Programme (TIP)
What the internship programme will offer you
You will gain experience in the strategic development and execution of marketing and communication programmes that enhance the corporate and brand reputation of Changi Airport.

As part of your internship, you will have opportunities to participate in work related to social media management and content creation, content marketing, digital marketing, media relations, and internal communications. You will also be able to contribute to promotional campaigns that showcase Changi Airport's offerings to visitors and travellers.
Hear more about the internship experience from our former interns in the video below.
Duration and application period
An internship with the Corporate and Marketing Communications team is typically for a duration of six months.
University students
Duration: January to June [Application: August to September]
Duration:  July to December [Application: February to March]
Polytechnic students
Duration: March to August [Application: October to November]
Duration: September to February [Application: April to May]
Requirements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Competency in photography and video production
Familiarity with digital/social media tools and channels
Familiarity with design tools
Specialist/major in Corporate Communications/Marketing/Digital & Social Media/Business
For applications and enquiries, please email:
social@changiairport.com
About the internship
You will embark on a unique journey to learn deeply about airport operations and transforming Changi Airport’s operations.​

As part of the Labs, Innovation & Transformation (LIT) internship, you will have hands-on involvement in operational trials, data analytics, tech research, development and prototyping in one of the five areas; Autonomous Vehicle, Ops Digitalisation, Robotics, RPA, and Machine Learning. ​
Hear more about the internship experience from our former interns in the video below.​
Digitalisation and automation projects
Mentorship opportunities
Exposure to the industry and emerging technologies
Opportunities are published on participating schools' internship portals.
For enquiries, please email:
getlit@changiairport.com

The Talent Internship Programme (TIP) is a 12-week summer internship programme for you to take full ownership of a real-life project in one of our business units. You will be empowered to recommend specific strategies that not only address pertinent issues but also forward-looking scenarios that has the potential to make a difference to one of CAG’s many diverse business areas.
We are currently not accepting applications.
TIP is a comprehensive internship programme. Here's what to expect.
Challenging and varied projects in one of our business divisions and contribute towards a meaningful group project under Changi Foundation, our philanthropic arm.
Guidance from our experienced team of supervisors.
Opportunity to interact, network, and present key findings to CAG leaders.
Outstanding interns will be considered for advanced employment.
Find out what it's like to be an intern for Changi Airport Group (CAG).
Airport Management, Airport Operations Strategy & Transformation

The structure and rigour of the TIP were key elements that attracted me to the internship, and true enough, the autonomy to own and run a project proved indelible as I was regarded almost like an employee of CAG. I was entrusted with engaging numerous internal and external stakeholders, conducting a deep analysis on the industry, and drawing out a strategic roadmap which was eventually implemented by the project team. Moreover, I’m grateful that the internship allowed me the opportunity to get an appreciation of the mission, people and culture of CAG, which were key factors that made CAG stand out as an organisation. To all prospective candidates – I highly recommend that you join us and experience CAG for yourselves!
Airport Management, Airport Operations Planning

The CAG TIP internship was well-designed with projects that gave us the opportunity to take ownership of real-life problems and present realistic value-adding solutions. There was a great balance between having autonomy and receiving help from fellow colleagues who were ever willing to share their knowledge! It also gave us a very good glimpse into what full time employment at the airport would look like. The work was challenging and meaningful, and we got to interact with many brilliant minds too. You can also tell how much the organisation values its people when senior management takes time to engage the interns!
Airport Management, Airport Operations Planning

There is never a dull day in CAG and opportunities are aplenty. From enhancing the passenger experience to striving for greater operational efficiency and safety, CAG offers a dynamic environment for you to grow in. It is a privilege to contribute to a community that impacts the lives of so many and place Changi on the global stage.
Airport Management, Airport Operations Control

Great culture, amazing people, and a project for you to own. No two days are ever the same; on top of my project, I welcomed the inaugural flight of a major strategic carrier, organised a lunch with senior management, and coached students in a partnership with the Changi Foundation. What makes the work here meaningful is the opportunity for you to implement and test your ideas and see them become reality. If you’re looking for a place that will nurture you, guide you, and push you to new heights you wouldn’t have even dreamed of, look no further!
Commercial, Landside Concessions

Here in CAG, we are always on the hunt to stay ahead. I appreciate the autonomy and trust given to us to propose and lead game-changing projects in our quest to continuously be the World's Best Airport. The dynamic environment and constant global attention we receive mean each day breathes ever-burgeoning opportunities for me to challenge and develop myself.

As a Changi Airport Group Scholar, you will have the extraordinary opportunity to work at Changi Airport.
We make magic happen in every aspect of our business – turning different airport touchpoints into seamless experiences with innovation and technology.
Applications for 2025 are now closed.
WHY BE OUR SCHOLAR?
Build an exciting career in the dynamic and fast-growing aviation industry.
Embark on a multi-faceted career of diverse business functions through job rotations, secondments and overseas assignments.
Have the flexibility to pursue your preferred course at top local and overseas universities.
Broaden your exposure through overseas student exchange programmes, summer programmes and internships with us.
Scholarship Bond Period
Overseas undergraduate scholarships: 5 years
Local undergraduate scholarships: 3 years
Participating Institutions
Tenable at top overseas and local universities
Fields of study
All disciplines of study (excluding medicine and dentistry)
Scholars may pursue a law degree but will not be employed as practising lawyers during their service with CAG
All tuition and compulsory fees
Monthly maintenance allowance
Pre-studies allowances, including warm clothing, settling-in and computer allowance (one-off)
Return economy airfare (overseas) / Hostel fees (local)
Opportunities for sponsorship of student exchange or summer programmes
Postgraduate sponsorship upon approval by management
Internships with the diverse business areas within Changi Airport Group
Excellent 'A' Level results or equivalent
Outstanding CCA/NS records or involvement in community activities
Passion to make a difference in CAG through the diverse business areas of managing and operating
Students of all nationalities are welcome to apply.
Hear what our scholars have to say about their journey at Changi Airport Group.
Air Hub & Cargo Development

To expand Changi Airport’s footprint on the world, we are constantly challenged to think deeply and reinvent the way we do things. Through my role, I deepen relationships and develop business cases with airline and trade partners from all over the world while also expand my horizons in the process. Given how multi-faceted the airport business is, you will find something fulfilling in your journey with CAG and be supported to achieve your personal and professional goals.
Masters in Management, London Business School BSc in Biochemistry with Management, Imperial College London
Airport Operations Planning

There is never a dull day in CAG. Our work is exciting and purposeful because of our consistent pursuit of excellence in passenger experience. Through strong camaraderie and support levers, we are able to explore innovative solutions, implement cutting-edge technology and overcome operational challenges. My experiences in CAG has supercharged my personal development and made many fond memories. Join us on this exceptional journey!
BSc in Economics and Applied Statistics, Singapore Management University
Airside Concessions

CAG is a truly unique place where, regardless of our backgrounds, interests, and aspirations, all of us work towards a common goal in shaping Changi Airport’s future as the best Airport in the World and the pride of Singapore. Here at CAG, you never lack opportunities for personal developments and professional growths. If you are purpose-driven, hungry to learn, and have a heart for service, CAG would be a wonderful place where you start and grow your career!
BA in Communication Studies with a Second Major in Business, Nanyang Technological University

Frequently Asked Questions
What makes Changi Airport tick? What’s the special ingredient to create the unique Changi Experience? How does Changi get its busy terminals and airside to work together like clockwork?
Visitors will get a chance to learn about Changi’s people, operations, developments and more in Changi’s very own Airport Tours!
For organisations based in Singapore, sign up for Changi’s Airport Tours now!
If your organisation is from outside Singapore and you are interested to tour Changi Airport, customised tours can be arranged. Please email us at

Visitors will have a better understanding of how Changi Airport Group designed our terminals and visitor experiences, what makes the airport tick and how we manage to stay the most awarded airport in the world since the airport started operations.
This is a walking tour of Terminals 3 and 2 for groups (max. of 30), not available for booking by individuals.
(Note: visitors should be at least 18 years old)
Sign up
Visitors will learn about what goes behind-the-scenes at Changi, to keep the airport going like clockwork.

Go on a bus tour in the airside to learn interesting nuggets of information and gain insights to special jobs at the airport. Visitors will also learn about innovations that the airport started trialling over the last few years.
This bus tour is for groups (max. of 17), not available for booking by individuals.
(Note: visitors should be at least 18 years old)
Sign up
Tour 1 costs S$545 (includes 9% GST) per tour.
Tour 2 costs S$1,090 (includes 9% GST) per tour.
Payment will be made using credit card, via our online platform. We will not be able to issue e-invoice or manual invoice.
There is no minimum group size.
Maximum group size for Tour 1 is 30 persons.
Maximum group size for Tour 2 is 17 persons.
For groups larger than the maximum group size stated, organisations should make additional tour bookings on another day.
Yes, but visitors who require wheelchair assistance should be accompanied by a fellow visitor.
Both tours will take approximately 1.5 hours to complete.
Tour 1 will start in Terminal 3 and end at Terminal 2.
Tour 2 will start in Terminal 2 and end at either Terminal 2 or 3, depending on the visitor's preference
Yes, you will need to go through security screening as part of the tour.
Please do not bring along any sharp objects, or liquids, aerosols or gel (LAGs) of more than 100ml, as these will be discarded during the security screening process.
Please avoid shorts, slippers or sandals.
Both tours will be conducted indoors.
For Tour 2, the airside tour will be conducted in an air-conditioned bus.
Yes. Please bring along your NRIC or work permit, as you will need to exchange it for your airport pass to enter the restricted area.

An action-packed bilingual mini web series featuring a firefighter and a social media manager at Changi Airport.

Love at First Flight is a web series produced by Changi Airport Group (CAG), telling heartwarming stories of romance blossoming between employees from different teams at Changi Airport. Each season features characters from a variety of job functions, shining a light on the often unseen, behind-the-scenes work that keeps the world’s most awarded airport running smoothly and efficiently.
FEATURED VIDEOS

The series opens with Gabriel and Xinyu reconnecting at Changi Airport after his transfer from Seletar Airport. Initially, a “‘distance”’ fills the air between the pair as they grapple with the fact that they are working on a new project together

Tensions rise between Gabriel and Xinyu as they try to reconcile their professional working relationship with the feelings they have for each other. Justin and Xinyu’s close relationship also irks Gabriel. Will the tensions reach a breaking point?
In the season finale, watch how the unresolved feelings between Gabriel and Xinyu pan out. Can either party find the courage to fight for the love that exists so obviously between them?
Catch up with the previous seasons of Love at First Flight!
Key Cast & Director
Shawn Thia is a Singaporean actor known for roles in Fried Rice Paradise and Titoudao on Netflix. He captivates audiences in both English and Mandarin dramas. He's engaged to co-star Xenia Tan.

Xenia Tan is a Singaporean actress recognised for her lead role in the award-winning film Wonderland (2023) and in Stranger Eyes, which premiered at the 2024 Venice Film Festival. She is engaged to co-star Shawn Thia.
Alexis Tan is a commercial director at Little Red Ants Creative Studio, known for her focus on deeply human stories that highlight the unique individualities of her characters.
Behind the Scenes & Featured Roles
Join us behind the scenes to discover the special locations where the web series was filmed. Read more about where the series was filmed, and answer simple questions to win Jewel vouchers!

Did you catch these moments? From heartwarming encounters to scenic strolls under twinkling lights, Love at First Flight 3 highlights why this vibrant aviation hub is perfect for an unforgettable date.

WHAT WE DO
MEET OUR PEOPLE
We always set the bar high at Changi Airport Group, especially when it concerns the safety of our passengers.
Airport Emergency Service
We train for every possibility to ensure that the fire safety standards across Changi Airport, Seletar Airport and the RSAF airbases are never compromised.
We rise to the #AEStraordinary challenge of protecting our world-class airports and airbases.
Employee Perks
Flexible benefits, staff discount, team bonding trips and more.

Changi Airport is growing at such a rapid pace. With Jewel and the future Terminal 5, I firmly believe there are plenty of career opportunities and avenues for personal growth to look forward to. At work, I constantly find myself in situations where I am forced to challenge the status quo and push the boundaries of existing operational methods and procedures.

I also have to anticipate future challenges and opportunities, so as to prepare my team of Duty Officers and Firefighters to handle the increasing complexities of emergencies that come along with the airport expansion. It is a role that gives me tremendous job satisfaction, and I am truly grateful to be given this opportunity to be part of the next chapter of Changi Airport.
CAG offers a pleasant and engaging working environment, with plenty of prospects for growth and wonderful colleagues from all walks of life.
Working in a team-centric environment has presented me with the opportunity to develop myself further and provided the ability to think outside the box to achieve desired outcomes.

It has been an exhilarating experience, filled with pleasant surprises, to be part of the company’s continual growth. AES has trained me to be a more resilient and patient person, offering multiple opportunities for progression. Within a short span of four years, I have gone from being a firefighter to my current role as a leader. I am extremely proud to be part of the organisation managing and operating one of the best airports in the world.
It takes a special type of person to be involved in rescue work. People are at the heart of what we do.
AES is a close-knit family that offers a myriad of opportunities to grow and develop as a leader at the world’s best airport.
Training is key in our bid for operational excellence, and it is as challenging as it should be. After all, nothing less is expected from the elite!

Passion, excitement & growth. These are what attracted me to join CAG and Airport Emergency Service (AES). Here at AES, I found my second home and I take pride in the fact that what I do matters to the lives of more than 60 million passengers that pass through our gates.

As part of the AES team, we ensure that Changi Airport’s safety standards remain world class through operational excellence and innovation. In addition, the diverse range of roles offers me learning opportunities to grow as a leader. For now, I am excited to be part of the Development team that prepares and plans for the future Terminal 5.

AES provides rescue and fire protection at both our airports - Changi and Seletar, as well as the RSAF Air Bases in Singapore. We take pride in ensuring the safety of our passengers through conducting aircraft emergency exercises, effecting airport emergency plans and mitigating the impact of aircraft accidents. A strong sense of duty to keep the world’s best airport safe keeps me motivated and the desire for innovation across all divisions challenges me to never rest on our laurels. We are always ready!
Ready to be #AEStraordinary?​

Frequently Asked Questions About Changi Airport
To ensure a holistic and fair assessment of all applications, we encourage you to apply only through our

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified by our recruiters for an interview. If you haven’t heard from us in two months about your application, it is likely that we have proceeded with other candidates for that particular role.

For most of our published roles, we accept applications on a rolling basis until the position has been filled. Unless specified in the job description, there is no application deadline, although we encourage you to apply sooner rather than later. If there is a deadline specified in the job description and the deadline has lapsed, we are unable to accept further applications.

We send out offers on a rolling basis. The recruiter will contact you to discuss your offer typically within two weeks of your final round interview. Should you not have been advanced through the application process, we will notify you within two weeks of your final round interview. Due to the high volume of applications, we will not be able to provide individual feedback on the outcome of the application.

Our People Promise
Our people have a passion for service and are committed to creating experiences.
Our people are our most important asset in our mission to be the world's leading airport company and a vibrant air hub.
Together, we are Changi Airport Group:
Come make MAGIC with us.

We offer a unique work environment in a global, vibrant and exciting airport community. With a set-up of multiple businesses, we present challenging work and diverse opportunities for our employees to further their personal and professional growth. Our employees are provided with a platform to develop and see through their ideas and contributions, which make an impact to our organisation and to the communities we serve locally and globally.
Join Us

The Randstad Employer Brand Awards recognises Singapore’s most attractive employers, based on the perceived attractiveness of 75 of the largest commercial companies (by employee size) in Singapore. In 2016 and 2018, we were named Singapore’s Most Attractive Employer by Randstad and remains consistently among the Top 10 employers.

In 2017, we embarked on a Workplace Transformation initiative and turned the traditional office space into one that facilitates collaboration and innovation. Our new workplace features open-concept workstations, beautiful pantries, and meeting areas that cater to both formal meetings as well as casual chats over a cup of coffee.

Terminal H (where "H" stands for the heart of the company) is the core of our people strategy to build deep engagement with - and among - our people. Some of the initiatives include "Fun Friday", where employees come together and bond over fun and thematic activities, such as art jamming sessions. We also have an extensive workplace wellness programme to promote healthy living, with complimentary fitness classes, cooking classes, and more.

Our people’s ability to grow professionally and personally is important to us. We strive to help our employees reach their highest potential, and encourage them to take a proactive role in learning and development. We conduct programmes that create opportunities to enhance their professional and management skills, knowledge and abilities. For example, the annual Learning Festival—a week-long festival packed with workshops and talks by various high profile industry speakers, created a conducive environment for active sharing and learning.

BASEMENT 1: DOOR 1 - 12
Follow the signs to 'Arrival Pick-up' or 'Ride-Hailing Pick-up' and take the lift/ travellator to Basement 1 after collecting your baggage. Please follow the signs to Doors 1 - 6 or Doors 7 - 12.
On Airport Boulevard, stay on the centre lane towards 'Terminal 1 Arrival'.
Swing right and proceed on the down-ramp to 'Terminal 1 Arrival Pick-up'.
For Private and Ride-hailing pick-up, follow the signs and proceed to Doors 1 – 6 or Doors 7 – 12 after the down-ramp.

BASEMENT 1
DOOR 1 – 5
BY WALKING
Follow the signs to 'Arrival Pick-up' and take the down-riding escalator to Basement 1 after collecting your baggage. Pick-ups can take place at Doors 1-5.

Follow the signs to 'Arrival Pick-up' and keep right to arrive at Basement 1.

BY WALKING
Follow the signs to 'Arrival Pick-up' located at Level 1. For Ride Hailing Pick-up, please follow the signs to 'Ride Hailing Pick-up' located at Level 1.
BY DRIVING
For drivers heading to Terminal 4 via ECP; keep left upon reaching Airport Boulevard and follow the signs to Terminal 4.
For drivers heading to Terminal 4 via PIE, keep left and take the dedicated slip road to Terminal 4.
Upon entering the Terminal 4 roadway system from either ECP or PIE, follow the signs to 'Arrival Pick-up'.
For Ride Hailing Pick-up, follow the signs for 'Ride Hailing' upon entering the Terminal 4 roadway system.

Please be informed that drivers are not allowed to park their vehicles or wait for passengers at the Departure or Arrival kerbside or pick-up points. This is to ease traffic conditions and ensure operational efficiency at Changi Airport.
Passengers are encouraged to drop off at the kerbside nearest to the check-in rows that they are checking in at.

Conducting our businesses with the highest standards of ethics and integrity.
Changi Airports International Pte. Ltd. (

We recognise that, while our Suppliers are independent parties, their business conduct and actions have the potential to reflect on CAI. It is therefore our expectation that all Suppliers adhere to the standards of conduct set out in this CAI Supplier’s Code of Conduct (the “Code”). A Supplier refers to any individual or business that supplies goods or services to CAI and includes all employees, subcontractors, agents and other representatives who act on behalf of the Suppliers (collectively,

All Suppliers shall comply with this Code and shall also ensure that their relevant Representatives understand and adhere to this Code. A failure by any Supplier or its Representative to comply with the Code can result in CAI terminating the contract with the Supplier, disclosure of any legal violation to the appropriate government or regulatory authority, and/or the pursuit of any remedy available to the Company.

This Code does not represent a complete set of the Suppliers’ obligations and requirements in respect of the Company. All Suppliers must comply with all applicable laws and regulations, this Code and the Suppliers’ respective contractual obligations in relation to CAI.
The Code does not create any binding obligation on the Company and we reserve the right to amend the Code from time to time. The prevailing version of the Code may be found at CAI’s website.

Suppliers undertake to comply with all applicable laws and regulations in the countries that they operate in, and where they provide goods and services to CAI. These include, but are not limited to labor and employment laws. Suppliers must ensure that their businesses are conducted in accordance with applicable laws and regulations, that their financial and business records are correctly and accurately maintained, and that fair competition is practised (per applicable laws).

Suppliers shall ensure that all their business dealings are conducted with integrity, honesty and transparency. Accordingly, CAI does not tolerate, and no supplier shall engage in, any form of fraud, corruption, bribery, cheating, extortion, embezzlement or other improper behavior.

Suppliers shall never directly or indirectly give, promise or offer any gratification, inducement or reward to any of the Group’s directors, officers, employees or representatives to induce, obtain or retain an improper or unfair business advantage, or otherwise improperly influence decision-making.

Suppliers will promptly disclose any actual or potential conflict of interest between a Supplier and the Group or between any Representative and the Group. For example, if a Supplier’s employee is a family relation (e.g. spouse, children, parent, sibling) to an employee of CAI, or if a supplier has any other relationship with an employee of CAI that might represent a conflict of interest, the Supplier should promptly disclose the fact to CAI.

From time to time, Suppliers that have been identified by CAI shall, when requested, promptly furnish a certification and provide information that the Company requests in connection with its periodic revalidation of Supplier business relationship with the Company.

The Company is committed to the responsible management of safety and health risks, in line with widely accepted international and national standards. Accordingly, the Company has implemented an effective and robust safety management system that ensures compliance with safety regulatory Suppliers and their Representatives must likewise provide a safe and healthy working environment for all their employees.
Suppliers are further encouraged to have in place appropriate policies that are designed to promote the general health of its employees and prevent work-related injuries and illness.

Suppliers shall also ensure that its employees and Representatives are physically fit for work and not under the influence of alcohol, prohibited drugs or other incapacitating substances when providing goods or services to the Company.

Sustainability is a cornerstone of the Company’s approach to its operations at any location the Group operates in. As part of its sustainability efforts, key stakeholders are expected to work together with the Company to reduce the environmental impact caused by the airport operations. Suppliers are expected to comply with all local environmental laws and practices, such as those relating to waste disposal and pollution.

Suppliers should endeavor to minimise the impact of their operations on the environment. They are encouraged to establish environmentally-friendly and sustainable initiatives which are relevant to their respective business and operations.

If in the course of performing its contract with the Company, a Supplier has access to and/or collects, uses, handles or processes the personal data of any individuals, the Supplier shall ensure that it complies with the requirements of all applicable personal data protection laws. The Supplier must not transfer any such personal data to a third party without the prior written consent of the Company. All breaches should be reported immediately and transparently to the Company.

Any Supplier that has reason to believe that a Group employee or anyone  acting  on behalf of the Group, has engaged in illegal or otherwise improper conduct, should promptly report the matter to the Company via the following channels:
Email:
Phone: +65 6603-4949 (during office hours of 0830 – 1830)

All reports made will be treated with confidence. CAI will not tolerate any kind of retaliation against anyone who, in good faith, reports an actual or suspected violation of this Code or any other CAI policies.
In case of any questions concerning this Supplier’s Code of Conduct, Suppliers should contact CAI at compliance@cai.sg.

Background:

Velana International Airport (VIA), which is the main international airport in the Maldives, is located on Hulhule Island in the North Male Atoll, near the capital island Male. It is currently the only airport in the country offering international flights, thus serving as the main gateway into Maldives, which is known for its sapphire waters and pristine beaches.
In October 2022, Changi Airports International (CAI) won a competitive bid issued by Maldives Airport Company Limited (MACL) to provide consultancy services for VIA.
Problem:
Amid the evolving landscape of air travel, especially in the aftermath of the Covid-19 pandemic, MACL faced the imperative task of reassessing its traffic forecast and facility requirements.
Amid the evolving landscape of air travel, especially in the aftermath of the Covid-19 pandemic, MACL faced the imperative task of reassessing its traffic forecast and facility requirements.

There were also ongoing projects and new ones such as the Code F runway, seaplane terminal and upcoming international passenger terminal building which further underscored the need for an integrated master plan. MACL had to ensure that these projects aligned seamlessly with its overarching development objectives and do not deviate from the airport's strategic vision.

There were also ongoing projects and new ones such as the Code F runway, seaplane terminal and upcoming international passenger terminal building which further underscored the need for an integrated master plan. MACL had to ensure that these projects aligned seamlessly with its overarching development objectives and do not deviate from the airport's strategic vision.

MACL sought to review their existing master plan and airport layout plan to achieve a flexible development plan up to its planned capacity, as well as to provide growth opportunities, address new initiatives and explore options to facilitate the necessary long-term development for VIA.

MACL sought to review their existing master plan and airport layout plan to achieve a flexible development plan up to its planned capacity, as well as to provide growth opportunities, address new initiatives and explore options to facilitate the necessary long-term development for VIA.
Solutions:

A 30-year traffic forecast was done for VIA. Results from the traffic forecast provided the basis for the demand and capacity assessment for the major airport system, which include the airfield (runway, taxiway and parking stands), terminal (domestic, international and sea plane), cargo and landside roadway traffic.

A 30-year traffic forecast was done for VIA. Results from the traffic forecast provided the basis for the demand and capacity assessment for the major airport system, which include the airfield (runway, taxiway and parking stands), terminal (domestic, international and sea plane), cargo and landside roadway traffic.

Computer simulations have been extensively used in this review to assess the capacity of existing airport infrastructure and identify capacity bottlenecks. Enhancement solutions were also proposed to unlock capacity constraints in order to meet the forecasted traffic demand.

Computer simulations have been extensively used in this review to assess the capacity of existing airport infrastructure and identify capacity bottlenecks. Enhancement solutions were also proposed to unlock capacity constraints in order to meet the forecasted traffic demand.
CAI also engaged airport stakeholders extensively to explore different expansion proposals before producing the final airport master plan options.
CAI also engaged airport stakeholders extensively to explore different expansion proposals before producing the final airport master plan options.
Results:

The capacity assessment based on simulations provided insights into the congestion points of the existing and future airport system such as the airfield, terminals and roadway. The findings are quantifiable by the Level of Service (LoS), an industry performance benchmark, before and after the capacity improvement proposals.

Background:

Tom Jobim International Airport (GIG) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, is the country’s fourth busiest airport pre-Covid, and the main international gateway into the country’s top tourism spots. In November 2013, a CAI-led consortium won the rights to a 25-year concession for the expansion, maintenance and development of the airport.
GIG would soon play a critical role in Brazil’s history, as it welcomed the world in one of the biggest international sporting events: 2016 Summer Olympics (Rio 2016).
Problem:

There was a slew of challenges to tackle. Aging infrastructure, limited capacity, lagging processes, and a lack of commercial offerings. The task on hand was apparent: To transform GIG into a world-class facility in time for the Olympics and create the finest first impression global visitors would have of Brazil.
Solutions:

CAI and its Brazilian counterparts introduced operations and service enhancements, including new customer service counters, travellators and escalators, and landscaping, to uplift passenger experience.

CAI and its Brazilian counterparts introduced operations and service enhancements, including new customer service counters, travellators and escalators, and landscaping, to uplift passenger experience.
Airport capacity was boosted with a new 100,000-sqm concourse, 26 contact gates, and additional aircraft stands. A new multi-storey car park was also added for passengers’ and visitors’ convenience.
Airport capacity was boosted with a new 100,000-sqm concourse, 26 contact gates, and additional aircraft stands. A new multi-storey car park was also added for passengers’ and visitors’ convenience.

Within the terminal, the team reconfigured the layout and passenger flow to smoothen passenger journey and optimise space. The commercial area within the same terminal doubled, and seven new VIP lounges were established.

Within the terminal, the team reconfigured the layout and passenger flow to smoothen passenger journey and optimise space. The commercial area within the same terminal doubled, and seven new VIP lounges were established.
The team also selected a new advertising operator to consolidate and refresh all advertising spaces.
The team also selected a new advertising operator to consolidate and refresh all advertising spaces.

To further uncover passengers’ shopping and dining needs in the airport, the team conducted passenger survey and focus groups. Over 100 new retail and F&B outlets, including specialty shops, were brought in. To up the game, GIG inaugurated an 8,000-sqm walk-through duty-free store, the first in Brazil.

To further uncover passengers’ shopping and dining needs in the airport, the team conducted passenger survey and focus groups. Over 100 new retail and F&B outlets, including specialty shops, were brought in. To up the game, GIG inaugurated an 8,000-sqm walk-through duty-free store, the first in Brazil.
Results:

The team successfully overhauled GIG’s non-aeronautical business. GIG achieved the highest yield per pax among Brazilian airports. It also more than doubled the non-aeronautical revenue per pax within four years of taking over the concession.

The team successfully overhauled GIG’s non-aeronautical business. GIG achieved the highest yield per pax among Brazilian airports. It also more than doubled the non-aeronautical revenue per pax within four years of taking over the concession.

In August 2016, GIG successfully hosted the 2016 Summer Olympics and Paralympics. It handled an unprecedented number of travellers and registered the highest sales in its stores and restaurants. Travellers and media praised GIG, describing the airport journey as seamless and magical.

Background:

Changi Airports International (CAI) was an equity shareholder of Fukuoka International Airport Co., Ltd. (FIAC), the operator of Fukuoka Airport (FUK). FUK is the gateway to Kyushu, a vibrant catchment of 13 million residents in western Japan. FUK is the fourth busiest airport in the country after Narita, Haneda and Kansai airports.
Problem:

FUK is a highly slots constrained airport. When Covid-19 hit in early 2020, FIAC had to ensure airlines continued to maintain a high level of slots application. This was to position FUK for the strongest possible recovery, and for optimal future growth when the second runway is operationalised in 2025. Additionally, with flights grounded and low passenger volumes, there was a need to pivot to other sources of revenue.
Solutions:

CAI helped FIAC strategise and implement creative means of traffic development. This included moving airline engagements online, and creating tourism videos of Kyushu in Mandarin to maintain Chinese airlines’ slots application interests for FUK.

CAI helped FIAC strategise and implement creative means of traffic development. This included moving airline engagements online, and creating tourism videos of Kyushu in Mandarin to maintain Chinese airlines’ slots application interests for FUK.
On the commercial front, CAI worked with FIAC to introduce three unique, first-in-Japan, airport products.
On the commercial front, CAI worked with FIAC to introduce three unique, first-in-Japan, airport products.
1. Fukuoka Open Top Bus Tour: Paid service that allows locals and tourists access to the FUK airside on an open top bus.
2. Night Wedding Photo Shoots: Paid service that allows couples to take their wedding photos on the tarmac in front of aircraft, during airport curfew hours.
3. Premium Ground Handling Tour: Paid service that brings children and families to FUK’s food catering facility, and FUK airside to learn about ground handling.
Results:

FUK registered the highest international slots application growth among large Japanese airports during the Covid-19 period, indicating peer outperformance. Post Covid-19, FUK’s international passenger traffic recovered the fastest among large Japanese airports.

FUK registered the highest international slots application growth among large Japanese airports during the Covid-19 period, indicating peer outperformance. Post Covid-19, FUK’s international passenger traffic recovered the fastest among large Japanese airports.
New commercial products helped FIAC grow alternative streams of revenues.
New commercial products helped FIAC grow alternative streams of revenues.

New commercial products enabled FIAC to effectively engage the Japanese public even during Covid-19, building goodwill with the community, and positioning FIAC stronger for recovery. Channel NewsAsia reported positively on FUK’s new commercial products in September 2023.

Background:

King Fahd International Airport (DMM) located in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, is an important gateway to the country’s Eastern Province. The city is the fourth-most populous in the country and the centre for Saudi’s oil industry.

Changi Airports International (CAI) was engaged by the General Authority of Civil Aviation (GACA) of Saudi Arabia under a nine-year operations and management agreement to transform, commercialise and corporatise DMM.
Problem:

Back in 2008, DMM faced a serious traffic leak to a competitor airport in a neighbouring country. There was an urgent need to stem traffic outflow, strengthen air links, and reverse the airport’s declining market share.

On the non-aeronautical side of the house, the airport lacked commercial offerings that would provide a good retail experience for passengers. The immediate challenge was to relook the commercial layout and attract a good tenant mix. There was also a need to explore new revenue streams to strengthen the DMM’s financial performance.
Solutions:
CAI sent an experienced team of resident professionals and visiting experts to transform DMM and strengthen its competitiveness as a key gateway to Saudia Arabia.

The team adopted a multi-pronged approach. It worked with GACA to liberalise aviation policy at DMM to increase the airport’s appeal. To build air links, the team pursued airline partners by crafting compelling business cases. The efforts yielded fruits. Local carriers agreed to establish their base at DMM while new foreign airlines started to launch flights to DMM.

The team adopted a multi-pronged approach. It worked with GACA to liberalise aviation policy at DMM to increase the airport’s appeal. To build air links, the team pursued airline partners by crafting compelling business cases. The efforts yielded fruits. Local carriers agreed to establish their base at DMM while new foreign airlines started to launch flights to DMM.

To prepare the airport for the increase in passengers, airport operations were enhanced by injecting capacity, revamping processes and leveraging technology. In 2017, the team launched the Kingdom’s very first City Terminal, offering the convenience of off-airport check-in, 24 hours in advance.

To prepare the airport for the increase in passengers, airport operations were enhanced by injecting capacity, revamping processes and leveraging technology. In 2017, the team launched the Kingdom’s very first City Terminal, offering the convenience of off-airport check-in, 24 hours in advance.

CAI also strengthened DMM’s commercial positioning. The team harnessed  usable spaces in DMM’s huge terminal to double its commercial area. Tenant mix was enhanced to include many new international brands. New passenger offerings, such as an airport hotel, were introduced.

CAI also strengthened DMM’s commercial positioning. The team harnessed  usable spaces in DMM’s huge terminal to double its commercial area. Tenant mix was enhanced to include many new international brands. New passenger offerings, such as an airport hotel, were introduced.

To develop additional revenue streams, the team took advantage of the massive expanse of the airport site to establish a new Cargo Village in 2015. This strategic move not only buttressed DMM’s non-aeronautical revenue, it also positioned DMM as an important node in regional trade and enhanced the airport’s hub status.

To develop additional revenue streams, the team took advantage of the massive expanse of the airport site to establish a new Cargo Village in 2015. Results:

With holistic hub development and operational efficiency programmes in place, DMM surpassed its competitor as a leading air hub in the region. Its traffic also more than doubled to around 10mppa at the end of CAI’s partnership.

With holistic hub development and operational efficiency programmes in place, DMM surpassed its competitor as a leading air hub in the region. Its traffic also more than doubled to around 10mppa at the end of CAI’s partnership.
DMM’s non-aeronautical revenue also tripled upon completion of CAI’s partnership. Its financial position had turned around. CAI helped transform DMM from a loss-making to an EBITDA-positive airport.
DMM’s non-aeronautical revenue also tripled upon completion of CAI’s partnership. Its financial position had turned around. CAI helped transform DMM from a loss-making to an EBITDA-positive airport.
In July 2017, DMM was successfully corporatised as Dammam Airports Company (DACO).

Changi Airports International (CAI) is a leading airport investor, manager and consultant in the global aviation market. As a strategic partner, CAI designs integrated solutions that enable its clients and partners to fulfil their potential of being world-class airports.

As one of the leading airport investors and airport consulting firms, CAI has extensive global experience that spans 30 countries and more than 60 airports around the world, including Singapore Changi Airport. Some of its projects include Tom Jobim International Airport in Brazil, Chongqing Jiangbei International Airport in China, the first aerotropolis in India, Fukuoka Airport in Japan, Clark International Airport in the Philippines and four airports in Russia.

CAI is committed to being a valued partner in the global aviation market, creating airports of the future and delivering sustainable value to our partners and investee airports. CAI is a wholly- owned subsidiary of Changi Airport Group.
For more information on our sustainability policies, please

When the inaugural flight took off from Singapore Changi Airport in 1981, the airport had one simple goal – to accelerate Singapore’s economic development. The airport had to constantly innovate. In just three decades, annual passenger traffic at Singapore Changi Airport grew from eight million to over 60 million; and it established itself as one of the world’s most awarded airports, with more than 670 accolades under its belt. Singapore Changi Airport’s stellar performance and focus on aviation service improvement attracted numerous requests for consultancy services from airports around the world.
Changi Airports International (CAI) was formed to spearhead aviation consultancy services, management projects and global investments.

DOS AND DON'TS
1. If you notice any suspicious person or activity in any part of the Airport Premises, please call the Airport Police at
2. For any medical emergencies, please call Raffles Medical Group (RMG) at
3. If you spot any faults in any part of the Airport Premises, please call the Fault Management Centre at
4. For fire emergencies, please call Airport Emergency Services at
5. Smoking is only allowed at designated areas in the Airport Premises.
6. Self-conducted airport tours in the public area are subject to approval by Changi Airport Group. For more information, and to seek permission, please email
7. If you find any lost items, please hand them over to an Information Counter.
8. For any commercial filming and/or photography, please send in your applications to

1. Personalised transporters, such as hover boards, unicycle scooters, and other similar devices, are not to be used in any part of the Airport Premises, including the Skytrains, car parks, roadway systems, and MRT-linked bridge.

2. Self-powered transporters, such as bicycles, scooter bikes, roller-blades or roller-skates and skateboards, are not to be used in any part of the Airport Premises, including the Skytrains, car parks, roadway systems and MRT-linked bridge.
3. Playing of loud music from personal devices is not allowed in any part of the Airport Premises.
4. Touting activities are illegal and offenders may be handed over to the Airport Police.
5. Overnight stayers are not allowed.

6. Activities that involve the gathering of people, such as flash mobs, riots and illegal gatherings are not allowed in any part of the Airport Premises. Offenders may be handed over to the Airport Police.
7. Gambling and betting activities are not allowed in any part of the Airport Premises. Offenders may be handed over to the Airport Police.
8. Sporting, games or recreational activities, such as Frisbee, all forms of ball and racquet games, drones, and kite-flying are not allowed in any part of the Airport Premises.
9. Do not panic if you hear any fire alarm in any part of the Airport Premises. Please remain calm and follow instructions given by airport staff.
10. Do not bring your pets to the Airport public area, except if they are:
(i) Dogs in the service of Singapore Authorities;
(ii) Guide dogs accompanying persons with sight disability, or
(iii) Animals which are to travel on, or unloaded from, an aircraft.

Any person who is permitted by the airport licensee to bring any animal into the airport shall not allow such animal to foul any part of the airport or to cause nuisance or annoyance to any other person.

GST in Singapore has increased to 9% from 1st January 2024. Participating retail outlets in Changi Airport will continue to absorb GST for retail spends in public areas of Terminals 1 to 4 for eligible Changi Rewards members.
How It Works
Sample receipt:
For GST-registered retail outlets, the display price includes GST. Therefore, in this sample transaction, GST would already be included in the price of the item (SGD100).
Highlighted green label is the discount equivalent to a 9% GST amount based on GST-inclusive pricing (9/109 x SGD100 = SGD8.26).
The final price of the item is SGD100 - SGD8.26 = SGD91.74.

1.  Who may participate in the redemption of the NDP Pack?

All registered Changi Rewards Member is qualified to redeem a free NDP Pack on a first-come-first-served and while stocks last basis. Each Changi Rewards are entitled to one (1) NDP Pack only. Shoppers must present both their Changi Rewards e-Card to qualify for redemption.
2.  What time can I collect my NDP Pack?

A serialized pass will be distributed from 3 PM to 4:30 PM at the redemption counter located near T3 B2 ST3PS for Changi Rewards. The pass will allow Changi Rewards Member to redeem for the NDP Pack which will be distributed from 4PM to 4.30PM.
3. How many NDP Packs can I collect?
Each Changi Rewards Member can only redeem one (1) NDP Pack and the Changi Rewards Member must be present in person upon the collection of the NDP Pack.
4. If I am not a Changi Rewards Member, will I still be able to redeem the NDP Pack?

No, to qualify for redemption, shopper must be a Changi Rewards Member. Shoppers may sign up as a Changi Rewards member at no charge. After registration, shoppers will then be able to redeem the NDP Pack, on a first-come-first-served basis and while stocks last basis.
5. Can my family of 4 each receive a CAG NDP Pack?
Yes, if they are a Changi Rewards member and are present at the event. The Changi Rewards programme is open to all applicants who are 16 years old and above at the time of application.
6.  What is inside the NDP Pack?
Each pack will come with a foldable fan, a bucket hat, drinks and snacks.

About
Celebrate Singapore’s national flower at Terminal 3 with a 270 sqm floral garden from 21 July, featuring a seven-metre Vanda Miss Joaquim centerpiece and rare orchids like Dendrobium Changi Airport.

At Terminal 2, a six-metre floral Merlion created using 60 types of plants stands proudly by the Wonderfall, symbolising national pride and heritage. There are also floral displays featuring iconic local snacks like curry puffs that bring a sensory celebration of Singaporean identity.
Over at Jewel, over 1,200 red and white orchids will bloom from 1–31 August, including the special Dendrobium Jewel Changi Airport hybrid for Jewel’s 5th anniversary.

LIMITED TIME PROMOTION

Ready to set off for a flavourful cool treat at Changi Airport? Grab our limited edition popsicle "Changi Blossom", inspired by our unique Changi Scent. Carrying nodes of Jasmine Peach Oolong, refreshing Lemon Peel and soothing Chamomile, the popsicle is crafted to evoke the spirit of travel and adventure at Changi Airport.

Be sure to make this frozen treat a part of your memories at Changi Airport too! Summon your creative photography skills and take fun photos around the airport while enjoying the treat. Those who visit Changi Experience Studio (CES) can also snap a pic (or more) at a playful photo spot installation made just for popsicle fans.
Other popular flavours are also available, including Blue Sky Coconut, Malty Choco and Ice Cool Bandung.
MORE FUN AT CHANGI EXPERIENCE STUDIO

Enjoy an aviation-themed adventure at Changi Experience Studio as you learn all about Changi Airport through fun and games! Can you keep the airport running like clockwork? Try your hand at the games simulating various airport functions and discover fun facts you never knew about the airport.
How to redeem:
1. Purchase the SG60 bundle on Changi APP

About

In celebration of Singapore’s 60th birthday, locals ride free too! From 1 June 2025 to 31 August 2025, simply spend S$20 at Hub & Spoke Café or Overflow Bar at T2 on weekends or public holidays, and you’ll be eligible for this special perk. Each receipt entitles you to 2 free 2-hour rides — perfect for a fun day out with a friend or loved one! Limited to 30 redemptions per day, so come early!
How to redeem:
Spend S$20 minimum in a single same-day receipt at Hub & Spoke Café or Overflow Bar
Spend S$20 minimum in a single same-day receipt at Hub & Spoke Café or Overflow Bar
Upload same-day receipt through the Changi App or get yourChangi Rewards card scanned by café/bar staff to receive the perk.
Upload same-day receipt through the Changi App or get yourChangi Rewards card scanned by café/bar staff to receive the perk.
Book a ride and present booking confirmation at GoCycling Changi Airport.
Book a ride and present booking confirmation at GoCycling Changi Airport.
Rides can only be redeemed on the same day.
Rides can only be redeemed on the same day.

1.  Who may participate in the redemption of the NDP Pack?

All registered Changi Rewards Member is qualified to redeem a free NDP Pack on a first-come-first-served and while stocks last basis. Each Changi Rewards are entitled to one (1) NDP Pack only. Shoppers must present both their Changi Rewards e-Card to qualify for redemption.
2.  What time can I collect my NDP Pack?

A serialized pass will be distributed from 3 PM to 4:30 PM at the redemption counter located near T3 B2 ST3PS for Changi Rewards. The pass will allow Changi Rewards Member to redeem for the NDP Pack which will be distributed from 4PM to 4.30PM.
3. How many NDP Packs can I collect?
Each Changi Rewards Member can only redeem one (1) NDP Pack and the Changi Rewards Member must be present in person upon the collection of the NDP Pack.
4. If I am not a Changi Rewards Member, will I still be able to redeem the NDP Pack?

No, to qualify for redemption, shopper must be a Changi Rewards Member. Shoppers may sign up as a Changi Rewards member at no charge. After registration, shoppers will then be able to redeem the NDP Pack, on a first-come-first-served basis and while stocks last basis.
5. Can my family of 4 each receive a CAG NDP Pack?
Yes, if they are a Changi Rewards member and are present at the event. The Changi Rewards programme is open to all applicants who are 16 years old and above at the time of application.
6.  What is inside the NDP Pack?
Each pack will come with a foldable fan, a bucket hat, drinks and snacks.

About
Celebrate Singapore’s national flower at Terminal 3 with a 270 sqm floral garden from 21 July, featuring a seven-metre Vanda Miss Joaquim centerpiece and rare orchids like Dendrobium Changi Airport.

At Terminal 2, a six-metre floral Merlion created using 60 types of plants stands proudly by the Wonderfall, symbolising national pride and heritage. There are also floral displays featuring iconic local snacks like curry puffs that bring a sensory celebration of Singaporean identity.
Over at Jewel, over 1,200 red and white orchids will bloom from 1–31 August, including the special Dendrobium Jewel Changi Airport hybrid for Jewel’s 5th anniversary.

所有报名均不可退款、不可转让。任何取消都将被视为缺席，不允许退款。
1.1 SG60 樟宜机场慈善义走（“活动”）由樟宜机场集团（新加坡）私人有限公司（“CAG”）和 指定承包商或供应商（由樟宜机场集团不时确定的机构）（在本文中统称为“主办方”）共同组织。该活动旨在通过公益金(UEN: T08GB0034K) （以下简称“慈善合作伙伴”）为弱势青年和特需儿童项目筹集资金。这些条款与条件适用于虚拟和面对面活动，并且可在
1.2 主办方可自行决定临时或永久修改这些条款与条件，暂停、中止或限制对活动的参与，而无需通知参与者。除非另有说明，否则任何修订或更新将立即生效。在修订或更新本条款与条件后，参与者继续访问和/或使用官方网站或平台，即表示其接受修订或更新后的条款。参与者应定期查看官方网站和平台，了解条款与条件以及活动信息的最新更新。
1.3 参与者应注意，比赛注册不可转让或退款，并且在确认注册后参与者也不能更改比赛类别。
2. 注册
2.1 通过注册活动，包括但不限于完成和提交在线注册表，活动的每个参与者（“参与者”）承认并同意，条款与条件适用于他/她参与活动，并同意遵守不时修订的条款与条件。参与者同意，活动注册是参与者个人的，不得转让给任何其他人，也不允许任何其他人代替参与者参加活动。
2.2 作为参加活动的条件，参与者声明：
(i) 参与者已为活动进行适当（且）充分的训练 ；
(ii) 参与者并无任何可能在活动期间或因参与活动而导致或造成伤害或死亡的疾病、伤害或身体残疾；
(iii) 尽管主办方或其承包商在活动的推广、举办或营销中可能采取了任何行动或措施， 参与者仍应了解并负责评估参加活动的危险、危害和其他风险；和
(iv) 参与者声明，其已在注册表中（在线或其他方式）提供了有关其本人的真实、准确、最新和完整的信息（“注册数据”）；并同意在注册后有任何变更时，维护并及时更新注册数据，以保持其真实、准确、最新和完整。
2.3 参与者声明，参加活动的决定完全由他/她自己决定，并接受与参加活动相关的所有风险，包括但不限于死亡和/或任何伤害，包括但不限于永久性伤害。
2.4 如果主办方自行认为参与者无法继续义走，为防止其对自己造成更大的伤害或损伤，主办方保留删除参与者的权利。如果参与者在参加活动期间或在活动上受到伤害、事故或疾病的影响，参与者同意接受由参加或出席活动的医务人员自由采取其认为必要或可取的紧急医疗援助或预防性治疗。

2.5 参与者承认并同意，主办方和/或其代表可以拒绝参与者的进入、删除参与者或要求参与者离开活动和附近区域，和/或将参与者排除在参与活动和相关活动之外，而无需提供任何理由。在不限制前述内容的情况下，如果主办方和/或其代表认为有必要或适当情况下 ，主办方及其代表也可以采取上述任何行动，(i) 由于参与者的不适当、冒犯、辱骂或其他破坏性行为；(ii) 为了保护财产或防止财产损坏；(iii) 防止对参与者或活动的其他参与者和参观者造成伤害或确保其安全；(iv)出于医疗、健康或安全原因；和/或 (v) 防止或制止未经授权或非法的活动（如但不限于埋伏式营销或抗议）。

2.6 如果活动受到或将受到主办方确定的超出其合理控制范围的情况的不利影响，例如恶劣天气或其他危险情况，包括但不限于 MERS、H1N1、COVID-19 等的爆发（根据卫生部的建议）或雾霾（当空气质量污染物标准指数超过可接受的 PM2.5 读数或根据国家环境局的建议），主办方保留推迟活动开始或取消、推迟或重新安排活动的权利，而无需事先通知。如果活动发生此类延迟、取消、推迟或重新安排，主办方不对任何参与者负责，也没有义务退还注册费。
2.7 购买活动门票。活动门票只能通过第三方支付服务提供商“Stripe”（“支付方式”）以j借记卡/信用卡支付。参与者声明，他/她已提供有效且可接受的当前信用卡以使用服务。如果支付方式失败，上述规定并不限制或放弃主办方通过任何其他方式直接向参与者寻求付款的权利。参与者可通过
2.8 参与者的付款条款将基于其信用卡，并可通过参与者与其金融机构或其他信用卡/借记卡发卡方之间的协议确定。主办方不承担与支付方式安全相关的一切责任。参与者应负责解决与其金融机构、信用卡/借记卡发卡方或提供商之间的任何争议。

2.9 参与者同意，活动门票的费用和成本应缴纳当时可能有效的所有现行法定税费、关税、费用和/或收费（包括但不限于销售税、消费税）（“税款”）。如果任何此类税款以与活动门票收取费用和成本的货币不同的外币（“当地货币”）计价，则主办方或支付方式可将该外币兑换为当地货币。参与者进一步同意尽其最大努力，采取一切必要的和相关法律要求的措施，使主办方能够、协助和/或为主办方辩护，要求或核实与服务有关的任何已付或应付税款的任何进项税额抵免、抵销、回扣或退款。
2.10 只有在成功付款并发出确认电子邮件后，方可确认参与者的注册。活动严格不可退款，参与者不得更改其选定的挑战/类别。
2.11 一旦注册表被正式处理并接受，即使参与者因任何原因未能参加活动，注册费也将不予退还。主办方将仅通过指定平台处理并接受正式填写的在线注册表。参与者有责任检查他/她是否已正确填写并提交了在线注册表格，并检查该注册是否已被主办方接受。主办方对注册信息不完整或未能处理和接受参与者的注册表概不负责 。
2.12 如果参与者被发现多次违反条款与条件，主办方有权暂停或终止参与者的活动帐户，而不向其支付任何赔偿，并/或禁止其访问平台。
2.13 主办方保留随时取消或推迟活动或修改活动的任何部分的权利，包括日期、路线和/或地点，而无需事先向参与者发出个人通知。如果发生此类取消、推迟或修改，主办方将在官方网站上发布取消、推迟或修改的详细信息，并可在活动日期之前通知参与者。如果活动被取消、推迟或修改，除非主办方自行确定，否则已支付的注册费不予退还，并且取消或推迟的活动不得重新安排，主办方不对由此造成的任何损失或不便负责。
2.14  主办方保留自行决定为参加活动的不同类别设定费用的权利。
2.15 每位参与者证明，在注册活动时，他/她已年满 18 岁。如果参与者未满 18 岁，参与者必须在注册和参加活动之前征求其父母或监护人的同意，在这种情况下，参与者的父母或监护人证明其已阅读并完全理解，并为了和代表参与者同意本条款与条件。
2.16 每位参与者必须拥有一个平台帐户才能注册活动（即每位跑步者必须拥有一个 42Technology 帐户才能注册活动）。任何以单一身份或多个身份创建多个帐户的参与者都将违反本条款与条件，其帐户将被暂停或终止，并在暂停或终止后不得访问平台。主办方有权审查和调查所有欺诈或未经授权活动的指控，并采取一切必要措施，以确保公平的注册计划可妥善实施。
3. 活动类别
3.1 活动将有以下比赛类别：
(i) 慈善义走 2025年7月27
(ii) 虚拟跑步挑战 2025年7月1至8月31
本条款与条件所提及的“活动”，若无特别注明，可意指慈善义走或虚拟跑步挑战。
3.2 已注册现场慈善义走的参与者同意遵循指定路线，遵守交通规则，并服从活动官员、主办方保安、新加坡警察部队和其他官方人员提供的所有指示和说明。
3.3 如果出现恶劣天气或其他危险情况，主办方有权在活动日之前或当日推迟活动或活动的任何部分。如果恶劣天气或其他危险情况持续，主办方保留重新安排或取消比赛的权利，而不退还注册费。
3.4 除官方义走和医疗车辆外，在指定的步行路线上不得携带动物或任何形式的轮式运输物体（例如但不限于直排轮滑、婴儿车、推车、内置或附加滚轮的鞋子、自行车、电动滑板车、齿轮车、脚车或滑板）、球或其他可能造成伤害的配件。
3.5 活动当日不提供行李寄存服务。建议参与者在活动当天不要携带任何个人物品参加义走。对于参与者携带或遗留在义走和/或活动场地附近的物品的任何损失或损坏，主办方概不负责，也不承担任何责任。
3.6 未经主办方事先书面同意，不得在活动中使用无人机或任何其他类型的飞行物体。
3.7 主办方保留在活动期间（包括在起跑线或终点线）随时检查参与者的任何手袋、电子产品、附件或配件的权利。

3.8 注册虚拟跑步挑战的参与者将视为同意完成累计60公里距离的挑战，并可以多场跑步次数，于任何时间、地点，在2025年8月31日前完成。参与者必须使用主办方认可的附有内建GPS功能的运动程序记录每次跑步次数和距离，或提交跑步机的跑步资料。参与者必须于2025年8月31日前自行于官方网站提交所有的跑步完成记录，包括距离、时间、路线图等资料。参与者将全权为自身人身安全负责，并保证要准守所有交通规则，法律条规和安全使用道路的规范。对于参与者因参与虚拟跑步挑战活动或相关所遭受的任何损失或损坏，主办方概不负责，也不承担任何责任。更多关于主办方认可的附有内建GPS功能的运动程序可参考第13条条款(GPS 应用程序和使用)。
4. 筹款
4.1 在扣除所有税款、支付网关和管理费用后，所有注册入场费将用于为我们的慈善合作伙伴筹集资金。
4.2 购买活动票卷的同时，参与者同意将活动费用捐赠至慈善合作伙伴的筹集资金。
4.3 所有个人和企业捐款将共同计入为活动筹集的总资金。
4.4 樟宜基金会将等额匹配在活动中通过注册费和个人/公司捐款筹集的所有资金，总额不超过 S$60,000.00。
4.5 在适用的情况下，个人和企业捐款将直接通过捐赠网站或 Giving.sg（“Giving”）收到可抵税文件。
5. 促销代码和推荐
5.1 促销代码（“促销代码”）不可转让、交换、转换或兑换现金。
5.2 促销代码不能与其他优惠或促销代码合并或累积。
5.3 促销代码只能根据主办方为此类促销代码制定的具体条款，在主办方可能提供给参与者的营销网站或宣传材料中使用。参与者在完成活动门票购买订单之前，必须在“促销代码”字段中输入促销代码，才能使用促销代码。
5.4 参与者可以进行的推荐次数没有限制。在推荐政策仍然有效的情况下，参与者可以推荐任意数量的朋友。
5.5 如果主办方确定或认为使用或兑换促销代码是错误的、欺诈的、非法的或违反适用的促销代码条款或本条款与条件，则主办方保留冻结、扣除或删除参与者或任何其他用户使用促销代码获得的积分或其他功能或利益的权利。
5.6 主办方保留自行决定更改、暂停、取消和/或放弃促销代码及其适用条款的权利，无需通知参与者或对参与者承担任何责任。
5.7 主办方可自行决定向不同的参与者或参与者群体提供具有不同功能和不同费率的促销优惠或折扣。每位参与者同意，除非也向其提供此类促销优惠或折扣，否则其对服务的使用或对活动的参与无关。
6. 活动奖品
6.1 获奖者将在活动结束后 7 天内通过电子邮件或电话（根据注册时提供的详细信息）收到通知。奖品应自行领取，或者获奖者可以安排快递公司代表获奖者领取。如果获奖者在收到通知后 7 天内未回复，奖品将被没收。
6.2 奖品不可交换、转让，也不能兑换成现金。如果超出主办方控制范围的情况使这样做变得有必要，则主办方保留以等值或更高价值的奖品替代奖品的权利。
6.3 主办方关于每个类别/挑战的获奖者和奖品授予的决定应为最终决定，对所有参与者均具约束力。
7. 幸运抽奖
7.1 所有参与者均有资格参加幸运抽奖。
7.2 主办方对关于幸运抽奖的所有事宜拥有最终决定权。不接受任何与此相关的通信或上诉。
7.3 主办方保留在获胜者被取消资格时或被取消资格随后更换获胜者的权利。
7.4 主办方可根据第 6 、7段更改这些条款，暂停或终止幸运抽奖，无需事先通知。
7.5 获奖者将在 7 天内通过电子邮件或电话（根据注册时提供的详细信息）收到通知。活动奖品将通过快递自行领取/自行安排。如果获奖者在收到通知后 7 天内没有回复，他/她的奖品将被没收。
7.6 抽奖奖品不可交换、转让，也不能兑换成现金。主办方保留自行决定将奖品替换为等值或更高价值的替代奖品的权利。
8. 主办方最终决定
8.1 主办方拥有全权和绝对的自由裁量权，可就活动做出任何决定，且无义务提供任何理由。参加活动的参与者将被视为已同意并确认主办方的决定是最终的，对他/她具有约束力。主办方将不考虑任何上诉，也不会与任何参与者进行任何通信。
9. 安全和医疗
9.1 强烈建议参与者在完成在线注册之前以及打卡期/义走日之前和期间进行体检和/或咨询其执业医生。
9.2 建议参与者在参加慈善义走活动前 24 小时内不得饮酒、服用兴奋剂或任何药物。
10. 无责任

10.1 每位参与者对其参与活动负责。每位参与者承认，他们参加活动可能对体力有很高的要求，并可能涉及一定的风险，在选择参加活动时，参与者承认他/她接受与参加活动相关的所有风险，并且这种接受是他们参加活动的先决条件。每位参与者明白，他/她必须与主办方充分合作，并认真遵守所有安全说明、指示和要求。在法律允许的最大范围内，主办方、慈善合作伙伴、赞助商、合作伙伴及其各自的子公司和关联公司，以及这些实体的高级职员、董事、雇员、承包商、代理、代表、继承人、受让人和保险公司，不对可能因参与者参加活动而遭受或持续的或与之相关的参与者死亡或受伤、意外事故或疾病而可能产生的任何索赔、损失、损害、费用或责任（包括但不限于个人财产的损失或损害）和/或任何类型的损失或损害承担责任。在任何情况下，主办方、赞助商、合作伙伴及其各自的子公司和关联公司，以及此类实体的高级职员、董事、员工、承包商、代理、代表、继任者、受让人和保险公司均不对因参与者参与活动而产生的或与之相关的任何间接、后果性、特殊或附带损失、损害、费用或责任负责，无论诉讼形式如何，无论是合同还是侵权行为（包括疏忽）。
10.2 通过参加活动，每位参与者特此同意，在法律允许的最大范围内，免除和放弃针对主办方、赞助商、合作伙伴及其各自的子公司和关联公司，以及此类实体的高级职员、董事、员工、承包商、代理人、代表、继任者、受让人和保险公司的可能由参与者参加活动引起或与之相关的任何和所有索赔。
11. 知识产权
11.1 主办方是本次活动的所有专有和知识产权（包括所有信息、数据、文本、图形、视觉界面、艺术品、照片、徽标、图标、录音、视频、外观、编程软件、电脑代码、可下载文件、软件应用程序、奖牌、互动功能、工具、服务）或在官方网站和平台上或通过官方网站和平台提供的其他信息或内容的所有者（或被许可人，如适用）。
11.2 在遵守条款与条件的前提下，主办方授予参与者非排他性、不可转让、不可让渡、个人、有限许可，允许其出于个人和非商业用途访问和使用官方网站和平台。本许可可随时撤销，恕不另行通知参与者。主办方保留未明确授予参与者的所有权利。
12 关于使用官方网站和平台的免责声明
12.1 虽然主办方及其承包商努力确保事件和平台上的信息和材料正确无误，但不做明示或暗示的陈述、保证或担保，保证它们是完整、准确、最新、可靠或适合其预期用途。在法律允许的最大范围内，主办方及其承包商不对信息或材料中的任何错误、遗漏或不完整或不准确承担任何责任。有关活动的信息和材料仅供参考，在“原样”和“可用”的基础上提供给参与者，不作任何形式的明示或暗示的陈述、保证或担保。
12.2 主办方不陈述、保证或担保：
(i) 官网和平台适合或可在所有国家/地区使用，或其内容符合所有国家/地区的法律。参与者有责任确保其对官方网站和平台的访问和使用不是非法的或被其访问官方网站和平台所在司法管辖区的法律所禁止的，并符合该法律；
(ii) 官方网站和平台与参与者可能使用的所有硬件、软件和操作系统兼容；和/或
(iii) 主办方或其承包商服务的质量、适用性、安全性或可靠性。

12.3 虽然主办方及其承包商努力使官方网站和平台全天 24 小时可用，但主办方及其承包商不对参与者对官方网站和平台的访问不会中断、及时或无错误作出任何陈述、保证或担保。主办方或其承包商可能会不时进行维修、维护或引入新的设施和功能，这可能导致参与者访问官方网站或平台中断或其他停机时间。在法律允许的最大范围内，主办方及其承包商不承担任何明示或暗示、法定或其他的声明和保证，并且如果由于任何原因，官方网站和平台在任何时间或任何期间不可用，或官方网站或平台的使用或访问中断或运行缓慢，或由于通过官方网站或平台提供的任何信息而出现错误或遗漏。
12.4 在法律允许的最大范围内，主办方及其承包商不对参与者或任何其他人因以下原因引起或与之相关的任何损害、索赔、责任、费用或成本负责：
(i)  任何人使用参与者的用户名和/或登录密码访问和/或使用平台；
(ii)  任何恶意软件暴露（包括但不限于病毒、电脑蠕虫、特洛伊木马、间谍软件或其他有害形式的干扰）可能损害参与者的电脑系统、移动设备、软件、数据或其他财产，或者可能使其在访问或使用官方网站和平台时遭受欺诈。为免生疑问，参与者应负责安装和维护所有必要的防病毒软件或其他反恶意软件，并采取其他必要的预防措施，以确保其从此类恶意软件访问和使用官方网站和平台的流程的安全性和完整性；和/或
(iii) 从官方网站和平台链接的任何网站。官方网站和平台上指向其他网站的任何链接并不意味着对这些网站或其内容、运营、产品或运营商的任何认可、批准、推荐或责任。
13. GPS 应用程序和使用

13.1 对于提交给主办方的非跑步机结果，参与者必须通过基于 GPS 的移动应用程序提交结果，该应用程序用于通过卫星导航追踪体育活动，然后上传和共享此类活动。支持 GPS 的兼容的应用程序是 STRAVA 和 GARMIN，用于记录跑步距离、时间和路线。如果参与者使用其他支持 GPS 的应用程序，参与者可能需要手动将信息上传到官方网站、平台（或移动应用程序），并且主办方保留在有合理理由相信数据已被篡改或更改的情况下拒绝任何此类手动上传数据的权利。

13.2 与任何 GPS 应用程序或移动数据设备一样，追踪面板上显示的位置信息的准确性取决于参与者的设备与 GPS 卫星之间的连接质量和与移动电话网络的连接。这些可能会受到恶劣天气或高层建筑等环境因素的影响，信息可能会延迟、损坏或丢失。因此，追踪面板上的信息被视为设备在最后一次收到更新时的位置指南，并且可能会出错。使用设备和任何 GPS 运动追踪应用程序将由参与者负责，并由参与者自行承担风险。42Technology 和主办方均不对设备或任何 GPS 运动追踪应用程序的使用承担任何责任，也不对因此类使用而可能对参与者造成的任何伤害或死亡承担任何责任。使用 GPS 路线是为了根据提交的结果展示参与者完成的距离，以确保所有参与者之间的公平竞争。如果主办方在任何时候认为参与者违反了条款与条件或与其签订的任何其他协议的条款，或以不正当或非法的方式使用参与者的设备和 GPS 运动追踪应用程序，或以其他方式对平台产生重大不利影响，42Technology 和/或主办方可立即终止或暂停参与者对平台的使用，而不另行通知。
14. 隐私
14.1 通过注册并参与活动，参与者确认其已阅读并理解条款与条件末尾列出的数据保护声明，并同意收集、使用、披露、处理和存储参与者的个人数据（定义见数据保护声明）。数据保护声明构成条款与条件的一部分。
15. 一般条款
15.1 主办方可通过电子邮件或在平台上发布通知来联系参与者（如需要）。通知将在发送电子邮件或通知发布在平台上后 48 小时视为发出。参与者同意，这符合与书面通信相关的所有法律要求。
15.2 本条款与条件受新加坡法律管辖，并应根据新加坡法律进行解释，每位参与者同意接受新加坡法院的专属管辖权。
15.3 因本条款与条件或活动引起或与之相关的任何诉讼因由必须在诉讼因由产生后一 (1) 年内开始。否则，应永久禁止此类诉因。
15.4 主办方放弃条款与条件下的任何条款或权利，必须由主办方的授权代表以书面形式签署。
15.5 就其性质而言，在本条款终止后仍然有效的条款（包括第 2、4、6、7、8、9、10、11、12、13 和 14 条）将继续有效。
15.6 如果具有司法管辖权的法院认定本条款与条件的任何条款在任何司法管辖区内非法、不可执行或无效，则该条款应被视为已被修改至纠正该非法、不可执行或无效的必要程度。如果无法进行修改，则该条款将被视为与条款与条件完全分离。本条款与条件的其余部分应保持完全有效，并继续对您具有约束力和可执行性。
15.7 未经主办方事先书面批准，参与者不得转让条款与条件下的利益和权利。主办方可在未经参与者同意的情况下，将条款与条件下的利益、权利和责任转让给 (i) 其各自的子公司或相关/关联公司；(ii) 其股权、业务或资产的收购者；或 (iii) 合并后的继任者。参与者与主办方之间不存在或不应因条款与条件而产生任何合资、合伙、雇佣或代理关系。

4. 主办方和 42Technology 可能会出于上述一项或多项目的，将参与者的个人数据披露给参与活动的第三方服务提供商或代理（无论是在新加坡还是在此类服务提供商所在的世界其他地方）。
6.  主办方和 42Technology 可在活动结束后的合理时间段内继续出于相关目的收集、使用、披露、处理和存储参与者的个人数据，包括在允许主办方和/或 42Technology 行使其在任何合同下的权利的时间段内。
7. 参与者同意主办方和 42Technology 为相关目的使用和发布任何可能包含参与者图像、声音或声明的照片、运动图片、录音或任何其他赛事记录，并同意在任何形式的媒体（包括但不限于官方网站、报纸、新闻媒体网站、社交媒体平台（如 tiktok、Instagram、twitter、facebook、微博等））上使用和发布参与者的姓名和比赛成绩，而无需向参与者支付任何补偿或其他费用。
8. 参与者的同意延伸至参与者的 GPS 活动路线和细分地图，该地图源自基于 GPS 的移动应用程序和 Garmin 可穿戴设备，在参与者提交运行时上传。这些仅用于验证参与者的跑步情况。考虑到其他用户，参与者负责选择是否在平台的社交“新闻推送”上分享其基于 GPS 的细分地图。
1. 撤销同意
1.1 参与者对收集、使用、披露、处理和存储其个人数据的同意应保持有效，直至其以书面形式撤销同意。参与者可通过以下联系方式向主办方的数据保护官和 42Technology 提交书面请求，撤销同意，即表示其撤销同意，并停止为上述任何或所有目的使用和/或披露其个人数据。
1.2 在收到参与者撤销其同意的书面请求后，主办方和 42Technology 将需要合理的时间（不少于 10 个工作日）来处理该请求。
1.3 根据参与者撤销同意的性质和范围，主办方和 42Technology 可能无法继续向参与者提供商品和/或服务。在不限制上述规定的前提下，撤销参与者对收集、使用、披露、处理和存储参与者个人数据的同意将终止参与者的活动注册和参与。
2. 访问和更正个人数据
2.1 如果参与者希望 (a) 提出访问其个人数据副本的访问请求，或 (b) 更正或更新主办方和 42Technology 持有的任何个人数据的更正请求，参与者必须按照以下联系方式以书面形式或电子邮件向主办方和 42Technology 的数据保护官提交请求。
2.2 对于访问请求，可能会收取合理的费用。如果是这样，主办方和/或 42Technology（视情况而定）将在处理其请求之前告知参与者费用。
2.3 主办方和 42Technology 将在合理可行的情况下尽快回应参与者的请求。
3. 个人数据保护
3.1 参与者同意，没有任何互联网传输方式或电子存储方式是完全安全的。虽然无法保证安全性，但主办方和 42Technology 将采取商业上合理的措施来保护参与者个人数据的安全性。
4. 个人数据的准确性
4.1 主办方和 42Technology 通常依赖于参与者（或其授权代表）提供的个人数据。为了确保参与者的个人数据是最新、完整和准确的，如果其个人数据发生变更，参与者需要按照以下联系方式通过书面或电子邮件联系数据保护官，向主办方和 42Technology 提交更新。
4.2 如果参与者提供任何不真实、不准确、非最新或不完整的个人数据或信息，或者如果主办方和 42Technology 有理由怀疑此类个人数据或信息不真实、不准确、非最新或不完整，则主办方和 42Technology 可以暂停或终止参与者在平台和活动上的注册和参与，和/或拒绝其对官方网站和平台的任何和所有未来使用。
5. 个人数据的保留
5.1 主办方和 42Technology 可以保留参与者的个人数据，只要为了实现收集数据的目的而有必要，或根据适用法律的要求或许可，并且将根据法律停止保留参与者的个人数据。
6. 将个人数据传输至新加坡境外
6.1 参与者承认并同意主办方和/或 42Technology 将参与者的个人数据传输到新加坡以外的第三方服务提供商或代理。
7. 数据保护官
